title: 112_s2107
content: The Act may be cited as the "Social Security Preservation through Individual Choice Enhancement Act" and includes an election for employees to take a payroll tax cut. The Tax Relief, Unemployment Insurance Reauthorization, and Job Creation Act of 2010 includes an election for employees to take a payroll tax cut during a specified period. The Tax Relief, Unemployment Insurance Reauthorization, and Job Creation Act of 2010 allows employees to elect for a payroll tax cut during a specific period starting in 2012. The election remains in effect until revoked, and must be made before July 1 of the calendar year for which the remuneration is received. Revocation of the election is possible under conditions set by the Secretary. Employees can elect for a payroll tax cut under the Tax Relief, Unemployment Insurance Reauthorization, and Job Creation Act of 2010. The election remains valid until revoked before July 1 of the calendar year. The Secretary determines the time and manner of election and revocation.
